00026 template<int M>
00027 SturmTriggsSolver<M>::SturmTriggsSolver(MotionMatrix<M> &P,
00028                                         ShapeMatrix &S) :
00029   motion(P),
00030   shape(S)
00031 {
00032 }

00040 template<int M>
00041 void SturmTriggsSolver<M>::solve(const MeasurementMatrix<M> &E) {
00042   Eigen::JacobiSVD<typename MeasurementMatrix<M>::Base>         svd;
00043   ImageTransform<M>                             denormalisation;
00044 
00045   measurement = E;
00046   measurement.normalise(denormalisation);
00047 
00048   std::cout << "Normalised measurement norm =" << std::endl;
00049   std::cout << measurement.rowwise().norm() << std::endl;
00050 
00051   approx_scale();
00052   factorise_with_occlusions(motion, shape);
00053 
00054   std::cout << "First guess at motion matrix = " << std::endl;
00055   std::cout << motion << std::endl;
00056   std::cout << "shapenorm = " << std::endl;
00057   std::cout << shape.rowwise().norm() << std::endl;
00058 
00059   measurement.scale_and_fill(motion, shape);
00060   svd.compute(measurement, Eigen::ComputeThinV | Eigen::ComputeThinU);
00061   motion = svd.matrixU().leftCols(4);
00062   // motion *= svd.singularValues().topRows(4).asDiagonal();
00063 
00064   std::cout << "Sturm-Triggs singular values are:" << std::endl;
00065   std::cout << svd.singularValues() << std::endl;
00066 
00067   denormalisation.apply_to(motion);
00068 }

00077 template<int M>
00078 void SturmTriggsSolver<M>::factorise_with_occlusions(MotionMatrix<M> &motion, 
00079                                                      ShapeMatrix &shape) {
00080   MeasurementMatrix<M>  notMotion;      // nullspace of this is motion matrix
00081   MeasurementMatrix<M>  subspace;       // nullspace of this is a constraint
00082                                         // on motionMatrix
00083   Eigen::JacobiSVD<typename MeasurementMatrix<M>::Base> subspaceSvd;
00084   std::vector<int>      permutation(measurement.cols());
00085   int                   i, j, j0;
00086   int                   c;
00087   int                   srank;
00088   int                   nmRank;
00089   const double  singular_cutoff=0.001;  // cutoff value for rank calculation
00090 
00091   // --- calculate the best permutation of
00092   // --- columns of the measurement matrix
00093   // -------------------------------------
00094   for(i=0; i<permutation.size(); ++i) {
00095     permutation[i] = i;
00096   }
00097   random_permute(permutation);
00098   std::sort(permutation.begin(), permutation.end(), *this);
00099 
00100   std::cout << "Permuted measurement =" << std::endl;
00101   for(j = 0; j<permutation.size(); ++j) {
00102     for(i = 0; i<M; ++i) {
00103       std::cout << (measurement(3*i+2,permutation[j]) != 0) << " ";
00104     }
00105     std::cout << std::endl;
00106   }
00107 
00108   // --- calculate motion matrix
00109   // --- from subspace constraints
00110   // -----------------------------
00111   c = 0;        // current position in permutation
00112   nmRank = 0;
00113   while(c < permutation.size()-4) {
00114 
00115     std::cout << "Forming subspace from =" << std::endl;
00116     for(j = 0; j<4; ++j) {
00117       for(i = 0; i<M; ++i) {
00118         std::cout << (measurement(3*i+2,permutation[c+j]) != 0) << " ";
00119       }
00120       std::cout << std::endl;
00121     }    
00122 
00123     form_subspace(permutation.begin() + c, subspace);
00124 
00125     std::cout << "Subspace is =" << std::endl;
00126     for(j = 0; j<subspace.cols(); ++j) {
00127       for(i = 0; i<M; ++i) {
00128         std::cout << (subspace(3*i+2,j) != 0) << " ";
00129       }
00130       std::cout << std::endl;
00131     }    
00132 
00133     if(subspace.cols() < 3*M-1) {
00134       subspaceSvd.compute(subspace, Eigen::ComputeFullU);
00135       if(subspaceSvd.singularValues()(subspace.cols()-1) > singular_cutoff) {
00136         // -- found full rank subspace
00137         notMotion.new_columns(3*M-subspace.cols());
00138         notMotion.rightCols(3*M-subspace.cols()) = 
00139           subspaceSvd.matrixU().rightCols(3*M-subspace.cols());
00140         c += 4;
00141         std::cout << "Added contraint to notmotion" << std::endl;
00142         std::cout << "Singular vals = " << notMotion.jacobiSvd().singularValues().transpose() << std::endl;
00143       } else {
00144         c += 2;
00145       }
00146     } else {
00147       c += 2;
00148     }
00149   }
00150 
00151   /******
00152   while(c < permutation.size()) {
00153     // --- create constraint
00154     for(j = 0; c<measurement.cols() && j<4; ++j) {
00155       subspace.delete_columns(0,subspace.cols());
00156       // --- add a column to subspace
00157       j0 = subspace.insert_column_and_expand(measurement.col(c));
00158       ++c;
00159       srank = subspace.rank(singular_cutoff);
00160       // --- subspace must be of full rank
00161       while(c<measurement.cols() && srank < subspace.cols() && srank < 3*M) {
00162         subspace.delete_columns(j0, subspace.cols()-j0);
00163         j0 = subspace.insert_column_and_expand(measurement.col(c));
00164         srank = subspace.rank(singular_cutoff);
00165         ++c;
00166       }
00167     }
00168 
00169     // --- add nullspace of subspace to notMotion
00170     // --- if it is a meaningful constraint
00171     if(j == 4 && subspace.cols() < 3*M) {
00172       notMotion.new_columns(3*M-subspace.cols());
00173       notMotion.rightCols(3*M-subspace.cols()) = subspace.jacobiSvd(Eigen::ComputeFullU).matrixU().rightCols(3*M-subspace.cols());
00174 
00175       nmRank = notMotion.rank(singular_cutoff); // test
00176       //      std::cout << "nmRank = " << nmRank << std::endl;
00177 
00178     }
00179   }
00180 
00181   if(nmRank < 3*M-4) {
00182     std::cout << "Not motion singular values " << std::endl 
00183               << notMotion.jacobiSvd().singularValues() << std::endl;
00184     throw("Too many occlusions to fill in the Measurement matrix.");
00185   }
00186 
00187   ****/  
00188 
00189   // --- motion is approximate nullspace of the complement
00190   motion = notMotion.jacobiSvd(Eigen::ComputeFullU).matrixU().rightCols(4);
00191 
00192   // --- remove 'unscalable' flags in measurement matrix
00193   for(i = 0; i<M; ++i) {
00194     for(j = 0; j<measurement.cols(); ++j) {
00195       if(measurement.pixel(i,j)(2) == 0.0 && std::signbit(measurement.pixel(i,j)(2)) != 0) {
00196         measurement.pixel(i,j)(2) = 1.0;
00197       }
00198     }
00199   }
00200 
00201   shape.solve(measurement, motion);
00202 }

00210 template<int M>
00211 void SturmTriggsSolver<M>::
00212 create_connectivity_graph(Eigen::Matrix<double,M,M> &G) {
00213   int           v1,v2,j;
00214   int           connections;
00215   const double  k = -0.2;
00216 
00217   G.fill(1e6);
00218   for(v1 = 0; v1<M; ++v1) {
00219     for(v2 = v1+1; v2<M; ++v2) {
00220       j = 0;
00221       connections = 0;
00222       while(j < measurement.cols() && connections < 50) {
00223         if(measurement.pixel(v1,j)(2) > 0 && measurement.pixel(v2,j)(2) > 0) {
00224           ++connections;
00225         }
00226         ++j;
00227       }
00228       if(connections > 7) {
00229         G(v1,v2) = G(v2,v1) = exp(k*connections);
00230       }
00231     }
00232   }
00233 }
00234 
00241 template<int M>
00242 void SturmTriggsSolver<M>::approx_scale() {
00243   AdjacencyMatrix<M>            view_connections;   // graph of views
00244   int                           tree_root;          
00245   Eigen::Matrix<bool,M,1>       scaled;             // is this view scaled
00246   Eigen::Vector3d               cross_prod, pix;    
00247   int                           v,pt,parent;
00248   bool                          updated; 
00249   double                        scale;
00250   double                        parent_scale, child_scale;
00251   FundamentalMatrix             F[M];
00252   ImageTransform<M>             denormalisation;
00253 
00254   // --- create spanning tree of views
00255   // ---------------------------------
00256   create_connectivity_graph(view_connections);
00257   view_connections.shortest_spanning_tree(tree_root, spanning_tree);
00258   scaled.fill(false);
00259   scaled(tree_root) = true;
00260   std::cout << "Spanning tree = " << std::endl << spanning_tree << std::endl; 
00261 
00262   // --- create fundamental matrices for
00263   // --- each edge in the spanning tree 
00264   // ----------------------------------
00265   for(v = 0; v<M; ++v) {
00266     if(v != tree_root) {
00267       F[v].eight_point_algorithm(measurement.view(v),
00268                                  measurement.view(spanning_tree(v)));      
00269     }
00270   }
00271 
00272   // --- Do scaling over tree
00273   // ------------------------
00274   updated = true;
00275   while(updated) {
00276     updated = false;
00277     for(v = 0; v<M; ++v) {
00278       parent = spanning_tree(v);
00279       if(!scaled(v) && scaled(parent)) {
00280         // --- scale between v and parent of v
00281         for(pt = 0; pt<measurement.cols(); ++pt) {
00282           if(!measurement.pixel_is_occluded(v,pt)) {
00283             if(!measurement.pixel_is_occluded(parent,pt)) {
00284               pix        = measurement.pixel(v,pt);
00285               cross_prod = F[v].e_ij().cross(pix);
00286               scale      = 
00287                 cross_prod.dot(F[v]*measurement.pixel(parent,pt))/
00288                 cross_prod.dot(cross_prod);
00289               measurement.pixel(v,pt) *= scale;
00290             } else {
00291               // --- parent occluded
00292               // --- so start scale at 1.0 again
00293               // --- for later separation
00294               measurement.pixel(v,pt) /= measurement.pixel(v,pt)(2);
00295               // measurement.pixel(v,pt)(2) = -0.0;
00296             }
00297           }
00298         }
00299         scaled(v) = true;
00300         updated = true;
00301       }
00302     }
00303   }
00304 }

00306 
00330 template<int M>
00331 bool SturmTriggsSolver<M>::operator ()(int j1, int j2) {
00332   int i;
00333   bool b1, b2;
00334 
00335   // --- row 0 is MSB
00336   b1 = false;
00337   b2 = false;
00338   for(i = 0; i<M; ++i) {
00339     // --- this is equivalent to b = b XOR g
00340     b1 = (b1 == measurement.pixel_is_occluded(i,j1));
00341     b2 = (b2 == measurement.pixel_is_occluded(i,j2));
00342     if(!b1 && b2) return(true);
00343     if(b1 && !b2) return(false);
00344   }
00345 
00346   // --- must be the equivalent
00347   return(false);
00348 }

00353 template<int M>
00354 void SturmTriggsSolver<M>::form_subspace(std::vector<int>::iterator cBegin,
00355                                          MeasurementMatrix<M> &subspace) {
00356   int i,j,k;
00357   std::vector<int>::iterator    cEnd = cBegin+4;
00358   std::vector<int>::iterator    colIt;
00359   Eigen::Matrix<bool,M,4>       leafExpanded; // single pixel on its own?
00360   Eigen::Matrix<bool,M,1>       occluded;
00361   Eigen::Matrix<int,M,1>        colPosition;    
00362   bool                          updated;
00363   int                           colCount;
00364 
00365   // --- first calculate total number of columns we need
00366   // --- and map out expansions:
00367   // --- occluded     - true if row is occluded
00368   // --- leafExpanded - true if this 
00369   
00370   colCount = 0;
00371   for(i = 0; i<M; ++i) {
00372     occluded(i) = false;
00373     j = 0;
00374     for(colIt = cBegin; colIt != cEnd; ++colIt) {
00375       leafExpanded(i,j) = false;
00376       if(measurement.pixel_is_occluded(i,*colIt)) {
00377         if(!occluded(i)) {
00378           occluded(i) = true;
00379           colCount += 3;
00380         }
00381       } else if(spanning_tree(i) == -1 || 
00382                 measurement.pixel_is_occluded(spanning_tree(i),*colIt)) {
00383         leafExpanded(i,j) = true;
00384         colCount += 1;
00385       } else {
00386         leafExpanded(spanning_tree(i),j) = false;
00387       }
00388       ++j;
00389     }
00390   }
00391   // --- remove redundant leaf expansions
00392   // --- (4xleaves and leaves in occluded rows)
00393   for(i = 0; i<M; ++i) {
00394     if(occluded(i)) {
00395       for(j = 0; j<4; ++j) {
00396         if(leafExpanded(i,j)) {
00397           colCount -= 1;
00398         }
00399       }
00400     } else {
00401       if(leafExpanded.row(i).sum() == 4) {
00402         occluded(i) = true;
00403         colCount -= 1;
00404       }
00405     }
00406   }
00407   
00408   std::cout << "Occluded = " << occluded.transpose() << std::endl;
00409   std::cout << "Leaf expanded = " << std::endl << leafExpanded << std::endl;
00410   std::cout << "ColCount = " << colCount << std::endl;
00411 
00412   // --- now create subspace
00413   // --- column by column
00414   subspace.resize(3*M, colCount);
00415   subspace.setZero();
00416   j = 0;
00417   k = 0;
00418   for(colIt = cBegin; colIt != cEnd; ++colIt) {
00419     colPosition.fill(-1);
00420     do {
00421       updated = false;
00422       for(i = 0; i<M; ++i) {
00423         std::cout << "Starting " << i << " " << *colIt << " " << j << std::endl;
00424         if(colPosition(i) == -1) {
00425           if(!(occluded(i) && leafExpanded(i,k))) {
00426             if(!measurement.pixel_is_occluded(i,*colIt) &&
00427                (spanning_tree(i) == -1 ||
00428                 measurement.pixel_is_occluded(spanning_tree(i),*colIt))) {
00429               // --- start a new column
00430               std::cout << "Starting new column" << std::endl;
00431               subspace.pixel(i,j) = measurement.pixel(i,*colIt);
00432               colPosition(i) = j;
00433               updated = true;
00434               ++j;
00435             } else if(colPosition(spanning_tree(i)) != -1) {
00436               // --- add to an existing column
00437               std::cout << "Adding to column column" << std::endl;
00438               colPosition(i) = colPosition(spanning_tree(i));
00439               subspace.pixel(i,colPosition(i)) = measurement.pixel(i,*colIt);
00440               updated = true;
00441             }
00442           }
00443         }
00444       }
00445     } while(updated);
00446     ++k;
00447   }
00448 
00449   std::cout << "Setting occlusions " << std::endl;
00450   //--- now add occlusion expansions
00451   for(i = 0; i<M; ++i) {
00452     if(occluded(i)) {
00453       std::cout << "Setting occlusion " << i << std::endl;
00454       subspace.template block<3,3>(3*i,j).setIdentity();
00455       j += 3;
00456     }
00457   }
00458 }

00460 
00464 template<int M>
00465 void SturmTriggsSolver<M>::random_permute(std::vector<int> &p) {
00466   int i,j,d;
00467   
00468 
00469   for(i=0; i<p.size()-1; ++i) {
00470     j = i + 1 + (int)((p.size()-i-1)*(rand()*(1.0 - 1e-8)/RAND_MAX));
00471     d = p[j];
00472     p[j] = p[i];
00473     p[i] = d;
00474   }
00475 }
